reviewText:
This show is definitely a case of "right show, wrong network".  I was able to catch 2 episodes while it ran but then stopped seeing it in the listings so I assumed that it'd been a mid-season test show and would return in the fall but was sad to hear that it'd been canceled.

Julianna Margulies was great in the lead role and her delivery of the pulled together "with it" attorney by day vs a woman who is falling into an alcoholic stupor by night connected with me as a viewer.  I could feel her pain as a mother who had looked away for a moment as her child is kidnapped, I could feel her hope that the child is alive & would return to her one day and wanted to see more of her story - would she completely fall apart or keep it half together or eventually move on?

I liked the ensemble cast and was especially happy to see Keith Robinson (since I developed a crush on him after seeing DREAMGIRLS).I wish this show had been picked up by the TNT network since they seem to have a commitment to tv shows with strong female leading characters and I think that they certainly would've given the show more than 6 episodes to succeed which leads me to my final comment about this dvd "set" - it is too expensive for just 6 episodes of a now canceled show. Initially I thought that viewers would be getting at least 13 epis but I can't recommend the purchase but would highly recommend renting it because it had the makings of a good series but just didn't get enough of a chance to cultivate an audience.

A legal drama with an edge, "CANTERBURY'S LAW" was a series that had so much potential but was cut too short with only six episodes in the DVD complete collection.

The drama which aired during the Spring of 2008 featured Emmy Award Winner  Julianna Margulies ("ER") as the feisty defense attorney Elizabeth Canterbury.  A woman who seeks justice for the people she defends even if it means breaking the law.

Running the law firm Canterbury & Associates, she is joined by her partner Russel Krauss (Ben Shenkman) and her two attorneys Chester Grant (Keith Robinson) and Molly McConnell (Trieste Kelly Dunn).  They take on cases which seem impossible and a grand slam for the District Attorney but Elizabeth Canterbury has always outbest the Deputy Attorney General Zach Willliams (Terry Kinney).

But Elizabeth's personal life is anything but good.  Her marriage to her husband Matt, a law professor has gone down the drain since their son was kidnapped.  Three years ago, she took her toddler Sam to the playground and answered her phone for business and next thing you know, she lost sight of him and they don't know if he is dead or alive.

Despite being successful as a defense lawyer, her life has been spiraling down hill.  She has become a drunk after hours, she has been having an affair with Frank Angstrom (James McCaffrey) and because her husband has held his pain of feeling that she is responsible for their son's kidnapping, he wants to move on with their lives and declare him dead.  But Elizabeth believes her son to be alive.  And thus, her marriage life is in shambles.

To make things worse, because she has broken the law in order to win a case, now she is being investigated by the District Attorney and Grand Jury for jury tampering.

VIDEO & AUDIO:

"CANTERBURY'S LAW" is featured in 1:78:1 Anamorphic Widescreen.  The video quality is similar to a lot of dramas that are on DVD which has a bit of grain.

As for the audio, the audio is English 5.1 (Dolby Digital) and the series is primarily a dialogue-driven drama series with the occasional rock music that is played during certain scenes.  But the dialogue is clear and I had no problems hearing the audio.

SPECIAL FEATURES:

There are no special features on this DVD unless you count "previews" as one of them.  Previews are for "Damages", "The Lazarus Project", "Rescue Me" and "The Shield".

JUDGMENT CALL:

"CANTERBURY'S LAW" is a legal drama that had a lot of potential and Julianna Margulies did a really good job as Elizabeth Canterbury, a defense lawyer who is strong, feisty and a woman that no one wants to mess with but to show that behind that tough demeanor, her personal life is just in shambles.

With this series coming from Denis Leary and Jim Serpico who are responsible for "Rescue Me", I expected the potential for something explosive for the first season.  But it's really unfortunate that FOX canceled the series with only six episodes.

I definitely gave this series a try and I really felt that "CANTERBURY'S LAW" had so much potential and what urked me so much is that by watching these six episodes, there was an ongoing storyline about Elizabeth hoping that her kidnapped son is still alive. And to know that with no conclusion, we're left with an open ended series with no closure.

It's very unfortunate that the creator/director Dave Erickson was never given the opportunity to finalize the series.  Even if there was one last episode to tie up loose ends, at least it would have been some sort of closure to the series and its characters.  It's a shame to watch these characters taken to such highs but then taken to the lowest of low's and that glimmer of sunshine will never come.

I actually enjoyed Julianna Margulies performance and it was great to see her play this type of role.  After watching each of the six episodes, I really got into the main characters (the partner and attorneys at Canterbury's law firm) and seeing this battle of wits between Canterbury and the Deputy Attorney General.

I enjoyed "CANTERBURY'S LAW" but with only six episodes, the series definitely had potential. Unfortunately, the network canceled it too quickly and thus, the series never had any true closure to the series storyline or its characters.  And as entertaining the episodes were, you are left with wanting more but knowing that there is no more.  What a shame!
GREAT SHOW LOVE JULIANNA
Too bad this series did not last, although I did enjoy The Good Wife.

I may like this better than The Good Wife,  very close
Since the Good Wife ended, wish they would consider
continuing this series.

Although I didn't care too much for the Julianna Margulies character in the first two episodes, I really got to like the characters by the end. Too bad it was cancelled after six episodes. Worth watching if you like legal drama.

Not in the same league as "The Good Wife" but still a great legal drama that was sadly just six episodes. Anyone who appreciates the fine acting ability of Ms. Margulies will enjoy this show. I found it by accident and really liked it.

I purchased this DVD series. It arrived promptly to New Zealand and the packaging was perfect. I did not enjoy the DVD  series. It was disappointing because the characters were not likable. As attorneys/lawyers they had no joy or fun in their lives or moments of happiness. All the lawyers mostly seemed miserable in their personal lives and in doing their work and everything was hard going for them. Their lives were a grind it was hard to see the motivation and passion for why they would live their lives as like that. In the professional lives their were serious ethical lapses of judgment problems and the people were not nice people that one would want to know if they were real people. Lots of striving for wining cases at cost of legal ethics, morals and happiness and the people mostly all seemed judgmental.  The setting for the office, the city and their home lives was dreary. No one would want their lives or to live and work at that firm. A second season would not be worth watching if there was one.
Generally entertaining for a lawyer sho. I is a bit dated but worth a look. Low cost as well.
wish there was more
So much better than Good Wife, in my opinion.  Very sorry it ended.

You can see shades of Alicia in the last episode of this also ran courtroom drama that
ended when it should have.  I'm probably biased though as I think that The Good Wife is
one of the best shows that TV has had to offer in a long time, and I think that JM is almost
typecast for her role in that show.

She's too cocky in Canterbury's law, and the whole Porsche thing is too much for what Alicia would
be.  Alicia is also a better attorney and a better person, so we're talking about a radical tangent in
writing, as well.  I'm not unhappy that I bought CL, but it pretty much played out the way I expected.
I'd loan these discs to a friend and not worry about when I got them back.
I can't say that about TGW.  :  )
This series was great.  I totally enjoyed the DVD.  It was only six episodes and fast moving, but Liked it a LOT.
Loved this...non.idea why they cancelled these.

To bad the show was cancelled. Came across by Amazon recommendations and bit because of pricing but was not disappointed.

Probably a great series, considering who acts in it. However, I somehow did not notice when I ordered it  that it did not have subtitles or CC. Since I am pretty deaf, I have not viewed this item and probably never will unless a miracle occurs (and I am not wasting my prayers that it will).
I love to watch Julianna Marguiles & I know I will enjoy watching her in Canterbury's Law.

Thanks, Amazon, for putting this DVD set on my "recommended for you" list-- although I've been a fan of J. Margulies since her "ER" days," I somehow missed the 6-episode lifespan of "Canterbury's Law." Margulies' portrayal of "dark and twisty" Elizabeth Canterbury is a fascinating foreshadowing of some elements of her Alicia Florrick character. Both are powerful professional women who fight for justice (and for their clients), even if the fight sometimes requires bending rules (something Alicia has become more comfortable with over time). Alicia isn't as troubled in as many ways as Elizabeth, so I enjoyed watching Margulies' all-out, drunk-and-depressed emoting, particularly in the final scenes of the third episode of "Canterbury's" when every element of Elizabeth's life falls apart.

It would have been great if "Canterbury's" had not fallen victim to low ratings and the Writer's Guild strike-- even if it had been a one-year-and-done series, I'd appreciate having another 7 or so episodes to view, with further development of the characters of Elizabeth and her husband, as well as her law firm employees, all of whom seemed to be coming into their own by ep 6. On the other hand, if "Canterbury's" had been a success, who knows if "Good Wife" would have been made-- and that would have been a tragedy!
Great series. Really enjoyed the plot and the series how it evolved. Not long enough though.

I bought it because I love The Good Wife.  This is definitely not The Good Wife:  The action is too intense and becomes stressful, the focus is on the fighting, both on and off the courts, there is too much negativity.  Even Julianna Margulies manages to look obnoxious.
Great series, wish there were more
Julianna Marguiles is one of my favorite actresses.  She did a good job with this series.  The only problem is that it was over too soon.  I would have enjoyed more of the series.
The entire series has been compressed to fit on a single disc.  The resulting video quality is terrible.

I just happen to adore Julianna Margulies which is why I bought this series. This can NO WAY compare to "The Good Wife", or even her roll on "ER", but it's MUCH better than "Snakes On A Plane" was. hahaha  It kept me entertained any way, the story line isn't written that well, but she's gorgeous and over all NOT A BAD SHOW.
I can't figure out why they took this series off the air and yet they keep The Good Wife ongoing.

This show was a good show! It has characters with flaws and a pretty good story to back it up. The acting was great! Some parts might have been a little cheesy but what show on TV isn't a bit cheesy? lol Some of the camera work could have been changed. But over all a good show I think they should have gave it more time. 6 episodes isn't enough for any show. But The Good Wife started after this and maybe The Good Wife creators saw some clips of this and Julianna Margulies being a lawyer in the show. Either way I recommend watching this even just 6 episodes it was very entertaining!

Great T.V. Series, shame it didn't  make it to Australian screens. I am very happy I have seen it.

The DVDs are good, but if you like "The Good Wife" series, expect a much less polished production.  Julianna Margulies does an excellent job and plays much of the same type roll.  For the price it is worth the entertainment it offers and I would recommend it.  Remember there are only 6 shows in this series, but still very good.

AN EXCELLANT SERIES PITY IT NEVER WENT FURTH

If anything I think this series is better than The Good Wife - the main character is more interesting, there is less politics and more human interest. Production values are possibly a little less slick, but these are good stories, well acted.

Having missed this show on TV, I bought albumn on strength of other reviews and the current "Good Wife" show. Julianna is fantastic on this show! The story line is tremendous - as far as it goes - which isn't far enough. It's better than most of the current shows on TV. I find her 'gritty' personna a delight to watch as she challenges a politically motivated "justice" system - ala Philly style. Crying shame it was cancelled so soon. Highly recommend this item.

We purchased this series because we thought it would be a good fit before viewing  "The Good Wife"  We watched this series beore moving on to the Good Wife.  We enjoyed Caterbury's Law but thought it was not as good as "The Good Wife"  Acting was good but we did not get involved as much as "the Good Wife"
Loved it!  It has higher quality writing, acting and directing than almost any show on television now.  Cut short too soon.

Julianna Margulies (The Good Wife) stars in this engaging legal series.  She heads a criminal defense law firm that takes on interesting cases dealing with rape, murder, and mayhem.  She has a staff of several loyal underlings, all lawyers, who work with her.  Margulies, in this series, carries some heavy baggage.  Her young son Sam was kidnapped while under her watch several years ago and she is laden with guilt.  Her marriage (to Aiden Quinn) is falling apart despite attempts at marriage counseling.  Margulies plays a tough, quick-speaking and hard-nosed attorney who defends her clients to the max.  In her personal time, she has a fling with her investigator and drinks too much.  Unfortunately, Fox cut the series after seven episodes and so it is not as developed as it could be.  It shows a lot of promise and is a good series to rent from Netflix or Blockbuster.  I don't really recommend buying it as it's not a series one would watch more than once.

Such a shame a really good series like this never took off. It's much better than Harrys Law but I quess the fact that there wasn't a David Kelly involved shelved the whole series.
Another good series goes down the drain!
I loved the show, but didn't like that it was canceled and that there won't be any more!  It is worth watching, however, as the acting is so entertaining.

What is wrong with these networks?  This was quite a solid show, from what little I saw, and it should have been given more of a chance, a better time slot, something.  With Denis Leary producing along with J. Margulies and with Jace Alexander directing, it was a quality show about a troubled attorney whose marriage is crumbling not only due to her work but also due to the abduction of her young son.

Give it a shot!

Only 2 years before her role in Good Wife, Juliana nailed it in Canterbury's Law. The network should not have cut this one short- it has so much potential and the network needed a woman powered attorney. Her performance is amazing and you will not be disappointed. While you aren't left for closure it should not be held against the show itself- actors did a great job and the cases are touching and can/have happened in real life. If it is below $20 and you are interested in the law and courtroom- watch it. If you love Law and Order, Good Wife, Eli Stone, Ally McBeal and the like, you will love Canterbury's Law.

This was a great start to a series. Fox did not renew it and I do not know why. Margolis played the part to a T. Would love to see it continue, even though she is now in a CBS series that is also quite good. I found this by checking her list of TV parts on Netflix. Great way to find listings of work done by your favorite actors.

I have always liked this actress, an enjoyable series and a pity it wasn't continued.  Unfortunate that a "Complete Series" always leaves you hanging as it would be nice to have an ending, whether it's the one you'd like or not.
How disappointing that Canterbury's Law did not survive. This is one of the best legal shows I've seen and the entire cast was amazing - especially Julianna Marqulies!

I agree that this was a great show! It is so disappointing that a story with fantastic acting, great writing and a suspenseful plot that kept you hooked was just cut off by Fox after six episodes with nothing to resolve the great storyline. Julianna Margulies is absolutely riveting in the lead role! But since she is now starring in another show I love, "The Good Wife", clearly this show is truly done.

I LOVE the suggestion of another reviewer that this series would be a great movie!!! Let's see it done! Please!

I would love to see a movie with Canterbury as defense and Sebastion Stark 'Shark' as the prosecution. WOW what a TV series that would be !!!! Julianna Margulies at her BEST as Canterbury. Much better then she is in 'The Good wife'. Where is the next season.....hope she find her missing son.

I love Julianna Margulies acting style. Everything about her screams grace and depth when portraying her characters. I am loving 'The Good Wife' and in turn sought some other shows she had starred in to add to my collection.

I was pleasantly surprised to stumble across this gem of a series. I agree with others that the show had so much potential. The acting was brilliantly played out. The theme and recurring events patterning through the show kept you waiting and wanting for more.

It's obvious that the wrong network had the rights to air it. If this had been on primetime tv such as the likes of an awesome show, "The Good Wife" that Julianna now stars in, it would have soared in popularity and would have been given a real chance to succeed.

I'm into the fourth episode, wishing there was more than six. However, fortunately I can also watch Julianna shine in her latest endeavor.

I liked this show so much I also bought a set for Christmas. If you like Julianna Margulies, you will DEFINITELY enjoy this short lived show!
they could of done more.

If it weren't for the Good Wife I probably would have missed this short-lived TV show on DVD. Its good, sometimes similar to the Good Wife but also very different.

Canterbury is a complicated lady who is having difficulty in her marriage and pushes the envelope of the law which got her into trouble but we can see that she found a way out.

It's too bad it didn't last longer as it would have been an interesting series. I suspect because of this she was noticed and got the role in the Good Wife which was also an excellent series.
loved it.and price was right..
If you liked the Practice you'll like this.
They should have kept going with the show.
julianna marguiles.  Need I say more?  Good stuff.

As good as The Good Wife, but grittier and often more intense in the courtroom; I'm surprised this series wasn't picked up for more seasons.....Julianna looks her natural self (unlike in The Good Wife where she wears wigs of straight hair) which adds to the less polished and grittier sense of each episode; and the supporting cast is top rate as is the writing for these wonderful actors......
Not as good as the good wife
good show

Found this on Amazon who doesn't love Julianna Marguiles? She's amazing in this short powerful series. You can truly see how she developed her character for the Good Wife series. This series has so many twists and turns you'll definitely want to watch it over and over.
